title: UPDATE: No charges after 9-year-old shot in head
content:
LOUISVILLE, Tenn. (WVLT/WYMT) - The Blount County Sheriff's Office says there will not be any charges after a 9-year-old boy was shot in the head Tuesday night.
It happened at Riverside Manor Apartments in Louisville, Tenn.
Officials said the shooting was an accidental discharge of a weapon and that the boy's mom was handling the gun and it went off by accident.
Investigators said the mom was on the second floor of the apartment and the round traveled through the floor and subfloor to the first floor. That is when the bullet struck the boy on the forehead. Marian O'Briant, with the Blount County Sheriff's Office says it was a freak accident and that the boy is okay.
A video was shared by a neighbor showing the boy walking on his own towards a stretcher and holding his hand to his head while moving towards an ambulance.
The Blount County Sheriff's Office said the 9 year old boy is recovering at UT Medical Center.
